sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"扎牢，捆，绑"之意。
means: fasten ： 指把某物牢牢地拴在、钉在或锁在另一物上，使不能任意移动。
tie ： 普通用词，指用绳索等将东西扎紧捆牢。
bind ： 多指把两个或两个以上的人或物牢牢地系或扎在一起。
secure ： 指将某物紧紧地固定起来，使之完全无损。
chain ： 专指用链条或金属环将某人或某物锁住或系住。

word_mean: 包扎：用腹带或绷带包裹
结合：形成弱而可逆的化学键，如抗原与抗体间或激素与受体间

sentence.Network_en: It is expensive to buy and a bind to carry home.
sentence.Network_cn: 买这个费用很贵，搬回家也费劲。

sentence.Network_en: These compounds bind with genetic material in the liver.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些化合物在肝脏中与遗传物质实现结合。

sentence.Network_en: These may bind to receptor molecules on the surfaces of cells.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些可能会在细胞表面和受体分子结合在一起。

jx.jx_en_mean: To hold on bail or place under bond.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 保释：支持保释或以保证书保释

jx.jx_en_mean: (一般作 be bound over)(of a court or law) require someone to fulfil an obligation, typically by paying a sum of money as surety

lj.lj_ly: he was bound over to keep the peace by magistrates.
lj.lj_ls: 治安官命他具结保证不扰乱治安。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  bindan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch and German binden, from an Indo-European root shared by Sanskrit bandh

encyclopedia.content: 将一本地地址与一套接口捆绑。本函数适用于未连接的数据报或流类套接口，在connect()或listen()调用前...

entry.tran: 使紧密联系；使关系密切
entry.def: If something binds people together, it makes them feel as if they are all part of the same group or have something in common.

example.ex: It is the memory and threat of persecution that binds them together.
example.tran: 遭受迫害的记忆和威胁把他们紧紧联系在一起。

example.ex: ...the social and political ties that bind the USA to Britain.
example.tran: 将美国和英国紧紧相连的社会和政治纽带

entry.tran: 约束；限制；使负有义务（或责任）
entry.def: If you are bound by something such as a rule, agreement, or restriction, you are forced or required to act in a certain way.

example.ex: The Luxembourg-based satellite service is not bound by the same strict rules as the BBC...
example.tran: 设在卢森堡的卫星服务公司无须像英国广播公司那样遵守严格的规定。

example.ex: The authorities will be legally bound to arrest any suspects...
example.tran: 当局负有逮捕所有疑犯的法律责任。

entry.def: If you bind something or someone, you tie rope, string, tape, or other material around them so that they are held firmly.

example.ex: Bind the ends of the cord together with thread.
example.tran: 用线把这根绳子的两端捆扎起来。

example.ex: ...the red tape which was used to bind the files...
example.tran: 用来捆扎文件的红带子

entry.def: When a book is bound, the pages are joined together and the cover is put on.

example.ex: Each volume is bound in bright-coloured cloth...
example.tran: 每一卷都采用色彩亮丽的布面装帧。

example.ex: Their business came from a few big publishers, all of whose books they bound.
example.tran: 他们的业务来自于几个大出版商，这些出版商的书都是他们装订的。

entry.def: If one chemical or particle is bound to another, it becomes attached to it or reacts with it to form a single particle or substance.

example.ex: At present nobody understands why these three quarks which are in the proton are bound together...
example.tran: 目前还没有人知道质子里面的这三个夸克为什么会结合在一起。

example.ex: These may bind to receptor molecules on the surfaces of cells...
example.tran: 这些可能会在细胞表面和受体分子结合在一起。

entry.def: In cookery, if you bind a mixture of food, you form it into a mass by mixing it with a sticky substance.

example.ex: Bind the mixture with the raw minced liver and cook for 3 minutes more.
example.tran: 让混合物滚上切碎的生肝脏，烹饪3分钟以上。

example.ex: ...a divine mixture of vegetarian cheeses bound with egg.
example.tran: 素干酪和鸡蛋黏合在一起的绝妙搭配

entry.tran: 左右为难的境地；进退两难的境地
entry.def: If you are in a bind, you are in a difficult situation, usually because you have to make a decision or a choice and whatever decision or choice you make will have unpleasant consequences.

example.ex: This puts the politicians in a bind as to what course to take...
example.tran: 这使政治家们左右为难，不知道该如何处理。

example.ex: I'll advance you the money for it, here and now, just to help you out of a bind.
example.tran: 我现在就把钱预付给你，好让你摆脱困境。

entry.tran: 令人不快的事物；无聊的事物
entry.def: If you say that something is a bind, you mean that it is unpleasant and boring to do.

example.ex: It is expensive to buy and a bind to carry home.
example.tran: 买这个费用很贵，搬回家也费劲。

means.word_mean: 1. something that hinders as if with bonds

sentences.sentence: "Will this wallpaper adhere to the wall?"
"The grandparents want to bond with the child"

means.word_mean: 3. make fast; tie or secure, with or as if with a rope;

sentences.sentence: "The Chinese would bind the feet of their women"

means.word_mean: 4. wrap around with something so as to cover or enclose
5. secure with or as if with ropes;

sentences.sentence: "tie up the old newspapes and bring them to the recycling shed"

means.word_mean: 6. bind by an obligation; cause to be indebted;
9. fasten or secure with a rope, string, or cord;

sentences.sentence: "They tied their victim to the chair"

Sentence.sentence: One who has integrity is bound by and follows moral and ethical (道德上的) standards even when making life's hard choices, choices which may be clouded by stress, pressure to succeed, or temptation.
Compared with a hundred years ago, our lives are less tightly bound by social norms and physical constraints.
Even so, the shift in the centre of gravity to older age groups is bound to have a profound effect on societies, not just economically and politically but in all sorts of other ways too.
The generation gap is bound to narrow

sentences.cn: 他们捆住了小男孩的手。

sentences.en: Such a slogan will bind our hand and foot.
sentences.cn: 这个口号会约束我们的手脚。

sentences.en: He is binding a new book.

sentences.cn: 石头和水泥凝固得很牢。

jushi.english: Clay binds when it is heated.
The goods were binding when he came yesterday.
jushi.chinese: 他昨天来的时候,货物正在包装。
石头和水泥凝固得很牢。
